review_blob: Kind of too strong on the bourbon side. These seasonal blends are tough to do right, and they leaned a bit left with the liquor taste. Definitely meant to be sipped. Still tasty, but cant touch Backwoods Bastard.
Smells as sweet as it taste.Beautiful light amber color, medium white/off grey head. Wide appeal to taste palates. Only complaint- palate is a bit biting. Delicious overall

"(Thoughtful face) Black IPA.... I would say its the beer that instead of wanting to slap the devil out of it, you want to slap the Devil into you. BLACK IPA."- my esteemed roommate. Im not sure if I agree with that or not because Im not sure I know what it means. Its delicious. Bitter, dry, has a bite but is still thirst quenching. Beautiful rich brown/black appearance with small white head. Quality brewery, quality beer.

"Its got kind of a fruity, skunky, you know, hop to it. It definitely exceeds the usual pale ale category. Its approaching IPA." -my esteemed roommate. I have to agree with him on this one. He loves it more than I do, I wish it were more full bodied, and that the color were less translucent. Overall, another quality beer from a quality microbrew.

"Its a hoppy-butt-fucking-bastard"- My esteemed roommate. It is hoppy and bitter in all the right places, and the IBU rating at 65 is surprising, or at least it was to me. Tastes very natural and earthy. Overall, highly recommend.
